title: Views
content:
A view displays a list of records generated through a search or filter operation. Records can be filtered based on criteria such as:

  • Incident records where you are the assigned owner.
  • Change records with a common category.
  • Devices with the Windows 8 SP1 operating system.

If you frequently work with similar record sets, it is helpful to create a view that automatically searches, filters, and displays all matching records.

There are the following types of views:

Public

Views that are useful for everyone.

Users with the Create public favorite views role permission can create public views and further update and delete these views.
Private

Views that serve as shortcuts to lists of records that you work with regularly.

All users have permission to create private views.
Group Views that are useful for and accessible only to certain user groups.

Users with the Create group favorite views role permission can create group views, and further update and delete these group views.
Users with Administer favorite views role permission can update or delete Public and Group views created by other users.

Create views

You can create views in most Service Management modules such as Service Request, Incident, Knowledge, and Problem. The system provides the following two types of views:

  • Out-of-the-box views: Are pre-defined views provided by default. You cannot modify, delete, or remove these views.

  • Custom views: Allow you to create, modify, delete, or remove the view based on your preferences.

When you modify a custom view, an asterisk (*) appears next to its name to indicate unsaved changes. When you save the view using the Edit View option, the asterisk disappears, indicating that no further modifications are pending.
​​​​​​To create a view:

  1. Select an application module from the main menu.

    You can choose any module under Plan, Build, or Run on the main menu. Example: Choose Knowledge.

  2. Create a filter to produce a list of records. For more information about Filters, see Filters topic.

  3. Click the Edit Views option at the top of the page.
  4. Click Save view as. The Save View pop-up appears.
  5. Add the name of the view.
  6. Select one of the following Access options:
    • Private: If the view is only for your own use.
    • Public: If you want to make the view available to all users. The Public option is only for users with the Create public favorite views role permission.
    • Group: If you want to make the view available to specified user groups. After you select Group, an Audience field is displayed, allowing you to specify one or more user groups to share the view with. The Group option is available only to users with the Create group favorite views role permission.
  7. Click OK.

    Other view options

    You can manage your views with one of the following options:

    Option Description
    Save view

    Save the view when you create a new one or update an existing view. To make the view public or visible to specific user groups, you must have permission to create public views or group views.
    Save view as Save the view when you create a new one or update an existing view. To make the view public or visible to specific user groups, you must have permission to create public views or group views.
    Hide view Removes a view from the display list.
    Delete view

    Removes a view permanently. When you delete a public view, it is deleted for all users.
    Select view Enables you to search for a particular view.
    All Displays all public, group, and private views.
    Group Displays group views only. 
    Private Displays private views only.
